body_html:
There is a "toggle all runs" button.
I'll make it so that regardless of how many runs your TensorBoard has, when you click "toggle all runs" for the first time, it will turn all runs off. So if that's the clean state you want, you can always get it in one click, rather than depending on how many runs there were.
body_text:
There is a "toggle all runs" button.
I'll make it so that regardless of how many runs your TensorBoard has, when you click "toggle all runs" for the first time, it will turn all runs off. So if that's the clean state you want, you can always get it in one click, rather than depending on how many runs there were.
body:
There is a "toggle all runs" button.
I'll make it so that regardless of how many runs your TensorBoard has, when you click "toggle all runs" for the first time, it will turn all runs off. So if that's the clean state you want, you can always get it in one click, rather than depending on how many runs there were.
